thread.title: Utica Comets blank Syracuse Crunch in Lyon preseason opener
thread.title_full: Utica Comets blank Syracuse Crunch in Lyon preseason opener | syracuse.com

author: Syracuse Crunch
title: Utica Comets blank Syracuse Crunch in Lyon preseason opener
text:
The Syracuse Crunch was shut out by the Utica Comets 1-0 on Thursday in their first preseason contest at the Patinoire Charlemagne Arena in Lyon, France.
Syracuse goaltender Adam Wilcox turned aside 25 of 26 shots. His Comets counterpart, Joe Cannata, recorded a shutout, stopping all 27 shots.
Syracuse was unable to convert on five power-play opportunities, while the penalty kill unit shut down all four Utica man-advantages.
After a scoreless first period, the Comets opened scoring with 7:54 remaining in the middle frame. Joseph LaBate and Alex Friesen set up Niklas Jensen for a 3-on-1 play. Jensen skated in and fired on net. Wilcox appeared to make the save, but the puck trickled past the netminder and across the goal line.
Despite numerous scoring opportunities, the Crunch were unable to make a comeback.
The teams will meet again at 2:30 p.m. on Friday.
